text:
ST. CLAIR COUNTY, Ala. (WIAT) - UPDATE (6/8): The two suspects accused of
killing Moody PD Lt. Stephen Williams will have their next day in court June
25, according to court documents.

7-year-old Tapero Corlene Johnson and 28-year-old Marquisha Anissa Tyson are
accused of killing Lt. Williams at a Super 8 Motel last week. Both are being
held in prison without bond.

-

ORIGINAL (6/5): The St. Clair County Sheriff's Office and other law
enforcement officials announced the identities and charges against two
suspects accused of killing Moody Police Sgt. Stephen Williams Tuesday night.

The 23-year police veteran was called to the Super 8 Motel for a disturbance
in Moody, when both a man and woman shot aimlessly with multiple weapons at
Williams injuring him.

According to the St. Clair District Attorney, 27-year-old Tapero Corlene
Johnson and 28-year-old Marquisha Anissa Tyson have been charged with capital
murder and are currently in custody.

27-year-old Tapero Corlene Johnson (left) and 28-year-old Marquisha Anissa
Tyson (right) (St. Clair Sheriff's Office)

Authorities say that this is still an "ongoing, complex and intense"
investigation.

Moody Police Chief Thomas Hunt did announce that Sgt. Williams has been
posthumously promoted to the rank of lieutenant. He will now be referred to as
Lt. Stephen Williams.

\------------

LATEST POSTS

* LaGrange Healthcare Worker travels north to fight COVID-19

* Staying seasonable through the rest of the weekend

* Columbus woman's new North Highland home being built on the word of the Lord - literally

* Small aircraft makes emergency landing on Interstate 81

* Black man found hanged at California park; community members question 'initial impression' of suicide

title: Court date set for 2 charged in murder of Moody Police Lt. Williams, no bond given
html:
ST. CLAIR COUNTY, Ala. (WIAT) - UPDATE (6/8): The two suspects accused of killing Moody PD Lt. Stephen Williams will have their next day in court June 25, according to court documents.

7-year-old Tapero Corlene Johnson and 28-year-old Marquisha Anissa Tyson are accused of killing Lt. Williams at a Super 8 Motel last week. Both are being held in prison without bond.

-

ORIGINAL (6/5): The St. Clair County Sheriff's Office and other law enforcement officials announced the identities and charges against two suspects accused of killing Moody Police Sgt. Stephen Williams Tuesday night.

The 23-year police veteran was called to the Super 8 Motel for a disturbance in Moody, when both a man and woman shot aimlessly with multiple weapons at Williams injuring him.

According to the St. Clair District Attorney, 27-year-old Tapero Corlene Johnson and 28-year-old Marquisha Anissa Tyson have been charged with capital murder and are currently in custody.

27-year-old Tapero Corlene Johnson (left) and 28-year-old Marquisha Anissa Tyson (right) (St. Clair Sheriff's Office)

Authorities say that this is still an "ongoing, complex and intense" investigation.

Moody Police Chief Thomas Hunt did announce that Sgt. Williams has been posthumously promoted to the rank of lieutenant. He will now be referred to as Lt. Stephen Williams.
